channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: 元Business InsiderのEICジム・エドワーズ氏ら2人が、1日2分の情報を提供するパーソナル・ファイナンス・ブランド「MoneyIn2」をSubstackで立ち上げ（Clara Aberneithie/Press Gazette）
item.description:
Clara Aberneithie / Press Gazette:
Former Business Insider EIC Jim Edwards and two others launch MoneyIn2, a personal finance brand on Substack, offering two minutes of information per day  —  MoneyIn2 hopes to tell those who don't yet have money how to make it.  —  Open publishing and newsletter technology has “opened the market” …

item.title: 2021年から2023年までのニールセンのデータ：最も視聴されたストリーミング番組10本のうち9本は再放送だが、人気100タイトルのほとんどはオリジナルシリーズ（ブルームバーグ）
item.description:
Bloomberg:
Nielsen data from 2021 to 2023: nine of the ten most-watched streaming programs are reruns, but most of the 100 most popular titles are original series  —  Netflix isn't the most-watched streaming service in the US.  But it does have the most hit shows.  —  We are inching closer to Paramount having a new owner.

item.title: COLabが主導する30以上のコロラド州のニュースルームが、有権者の関心事に焦点を当てることで、2024年の米国選挙をより良く報道するための州全体のイニシアチブを開始（Corey Hutchins/Inside the News in Colorado）
item.description:
Corey Hutchins / Inside the News in Colorado:
More than 30 Colorado newsrooms, led by COLab, launch a statewide initiative to better cover the 2024 US elections by focusing on voter concerns  —  The news behind the news in Colorado this week  —  More than two dozen Colorado newsrooms have launched an unprecedented collaboration to better cover the 2024 elections.

item.title: スポティファイ、英豪のプレミアムユーザー向けにAIプレイリストのベータ版を開始、テキストプロンプトでプレイリストを生成できるように（Sarah Perez/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Sarah Perez / TechCrunch:
Spotify launches AI Playlist in beta for its Premium users in the UK and Australia, letting users generate playlists using a text prompt  —  Spotify already found success with its popular AI DJ feature, and now the streaming music service is bringing AI to playlist creation.

item.title: 情報筋によると、ソロス・ファンド・マネジメントがラジオ会社Audacyの筆頭株主になる動きは、より大きなオーディオ買収劇の始まりになるかもしれないとのこと（Max Tani/Semafor）
item.description:
Max Tani / Semafor:
Sources say Soros Fund Management's move to become the largest shareholder in radio company Audacy could be the beginning of a bigger audio buying spree  —  The Scoop  —  George Soros thinks it's good business, and perhaps good politics, to be in your ears.

item.title: 情報筋：スカイダンスとナショナル・アミューズメンツが合併すれば、デビッド・エリソン氏が合併会社のCEOに就任、エリソン氏は数十億ドルを投じてパラマウントの再建を目指す（Bloomberg）
item.description:
Bloomberg:
Sources: if Skydance and National Amusements merge, David Ellison would become CEO of the combined company; Ellison aims to spend billions to rebuild Paramount  —  - Producer, tech heir has a month to seal a definitive agreement  — He needs to sell Paramount's board on merger with his company

item.title: イーロン・マスクによると、「特定の人気アカウント」をブロックする裁判所の判決後、Xはブラジルで課された「すべての制限を解除」し、裁判所の判決に反抗している（Anthony Boadle/Reuters）
item.description:
Anthony Boadle / Reuters:
Elon Musk says X is “lifting all restrictions” imposed in Brazil after a court ruling to block “certain popular accounts”, and X is defying the court's ruling  —  Elon Musk is challenging a decision by a Supreme Court justice in Brazil who ordered his social media platform X …

item.title: フォーブス、フィナンシャル・タイムズ、スノープス、トラステッド・メディア・ブランド、その他のニュース出版社がAIチャットボットでどのようにサイト内検索を更新しているか（Sara Guaglione/Digiday）
item.description:
Sara Guaglione / Digiday:
How Forbes, the Financial Times, Snopes, Trusted Media Brands, and other news publishers are updating on-site search with AI chatbots  —  Publishers are testing generative AI technology to update a rather boring function on their sites that hasn't been updated in a while: search.

item.title: X、ブラジルの "強制 "アカウント・ブロック命令に異議申し立て（ロイター）
item.description:
Reuters:
X challenges Brazil's ‘forced’ order to block certain accounts  —  X Corp, formerly Twitter, has been “forced by court decisions” to block certain popular accounts in Brazil and is prohibited from giving details of the order, the company said on Saturday.  —  X owner Elon Musk said in a post …

item.title: 下院司法委員会を率いるジム・ジョーダン議員は、GroupMを含む大手広告主にトゥルース・ソーシャルに広告を出さない理由を説明する手紙を送った（Mike Masnick/Techdirt）
item.description:
Mike Masnick / Techdirt:
Rep. Jim Jordan, who heads the House Judiciary Committee, sent letters to major advertisers including GroupM to explain why they won't advertise on Truth Social  —  from the not-wanting-to-funnel-money-to- trump?  -that's-a-crime!  dept  —  Jim Jordan, who heads the House Judiciary Committee …

item.title: GeniusとEveripediaの共同創設者として物議を醸したMahbod Moghadam氏が、3月に41歳で亡くなった。
item.description:
Connie Loizos / TechCrunch:
Mahbod Moghadam, the controversial co-founder of Genius and Everipedia, passed away in March at age 41, according to a post on Genius attributed to his family  —  Mahbod Moghadam, the controversial, never-boring co-founder of Genius and Everipedia, as well as an angel investor …

item.title: ニールセン：女子ファイナル4のUConn対アイオワの試合は14.2Mの視聴者を集め、女子大学バスケットボールの記録であり、ESPN史上最も視聴されたバスケットボールの試合となった（Amanda Christovich/Front Office Sports）
item.description:
Amanda Christovich / Front Office Sports:
Nielsen: the UConn-Iowa women's Final Four match drew 14.2M viewers, a record for women's college basketball and ESPN's most-watched basketball game ever  —  Even with the men's Final Four about to tip off Saturday, the focus of the national college basketball world turned, again, to the women's tournament.

item.title: 220人のフルタイムスタッフと2200万ドル以上の年間予算を持つ、州の政治と政策に特化した全米50州の非営利ネットワーク「States Newsroom」を見てみよう（Cameron Joseph/Columbia Journalism Review）。
item.description:
Cameron Joseph / Columbia Journalism Review:
A look at States Newsroom, a nonprofit network in all 50 US states focused on state politics and policy, with 220 full-time staff and a $22M+ annual budget  —  In late January, after wrapping up his annual State of the State speech, North Dakota governor Doug Burgum (R) headed out to meet the press.

item.title: 情報源メタ社は、AIのトレーニングデータのためにサイモン＆シュスターのような出版社を買収することを議論し、訴訟に直面することになるとしても、著作権で保護されたオンラインデータを使用することを検討した（ニューヨーク・タイムズ）。
item.description:
New York Times:
Sources: Meta debated buying a publisher like Simon & Schuster for AI training data and weighed using copyrighted online data even if that meant facing lawsuits  —  To make artificial intelligence systems more powerful, tech companies need online data to feed the technology.  Here's what to know.

item.title: 情報源OpenAIは、Whisperを通じてYouTubeの動画を100万時間以上書き起こし、そのテキストをGPT-4の訓練に使用した。
item.description:
New York Times:
Sources: OpenAI transcribed 1M+ hours of YouTube videos through Whisper and used the text to train GPT-4; Google also transcribed YouTube videos to harvest text  —  OpenAI, Google and Meta ignored corporate policies, altered their own rules and discussed skirting copyright law …
